segment.source: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server
segment.target: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server

segment.source: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server
segment.target: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server

segment.source: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server
segment.target: How to Upload a MED-V Image to the Server

segment.source: After a MED-V image has been tested, it can be packed and then uploaded to the server.
segment.target: After a MED-V image has been tested, it can be packed and then uploaded to the server.

segment.source: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.
segment.target: For information on configuring an image Web distribution server, see How to Configure the Image Web Distribution Server.

segment.source: Once a MED-V image is packed and uploaded to the server, it can be distributed to users by using an enterprise software distribution center, or it can be downloaded by users using a deployment package.
segment.target: Once a MED-V image is packed and uploaded to the server, it can be distributed to users by using an enterprise software distribution center, or it can be downloaded by users using a deployment package.

segment.source: For information on deployment using an enterprise software distribution center, see Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System.
segment.target: For information on deployment using an enterprise software distribution center, see Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using an Enterprise Software Distribution System.

segment.source: For information on deployment using a package, see Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package.
segment.target: For information on deployment using a package, see Deploying a MED-V Workspace Using a Deployment Package.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before uploading an image, verify that a Web proxy is not defined in your browser settings and that Windows Update is not currently running.
segment.target: Before uploading an image, verify that a Web proxy is not defined in your browser settings and that Windows Update is not currently running.

segment.source: To upload a MED-V image to the server
segment.target: To upload a MED-V image to the server

segment.source: In the Local Packed Images pane, select the image you created.
segment.target: In the Local Packed Images pane, select the image you created.

segment.source: Click Upload.
segment.target: Click Upload.

segment.source: The image is uploaded to the server.
segment.target: The image is uploaded to the server.

segment.source: This might take a considerable amount of time.
segment.target: This might take a considerable amount of time.

segment.source: Images on the server are defined with the properties listed in the following table.
segment.target: Images on the server are defined with the properties listed in the following table.

segment.source: Packed Images on Server Properties
segment.target: Packed Images on Server Properties

segment.source: Property
segment.target: Property

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Image Name
segment.target: Image Name

segment.source: The name of the packed image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.
segment.target: The name of the packed image as it was defined when the administrator created the image.

segment.source: Version
segment.target: Version

segment.source: The version of the displayed image.
segment.target: The version of the displayed image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: All previous versions are kept unless deleted.
segment.target: All previous versions are kept unless deleted.

segment.source: File Size (compressed)
segment.target: File Size (compressed)

segment.source: The physical compressed size of the image.
segment.target: The physical compressed size of the image.

segment.source: Image Size (uncompressed)
segment.target: Image Size (uncompressed)

segment.source: The physical uncompressed size of the image.
segment.target: The physical uncompressed size of the image.
